title: Supporting science in Slovenia - The SRA perspective

Europe.
So my short presentation will be divided into 4 parts.

And.

PN countries.
So some words.
Institutional design.

Slovenian research agency is somewhere in between between ministries and between scientific community so ministries give US funds and then we make calls for proposals for projects for young researchers and the main money comes from Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology.
More than 90% of our money.

More than 5% comes from Ministry of Defence, Ministry of Defence of Slovenia has decided to to play the similar role As for example, Ministry of Defense in United States of America to support research doesn't mean that it's that it's secret, actually, it's not secret, it's all open and we appreciate this font a lot and it's important is also project few percent of our.
Budget comes from other ministries, so each year or two years we have call for proposal, very different ministries.

So so maybe these 2195.
Come closer, but for real.
Real move toward this this target we have to change some activities very substantially.
Of course, effectiveness of public investment.
That is what?
What is one of the main goals of research agency?
Strengthening human human resources?

Each year we fund around 300 to new post doctoral students.
It means funding of their salaries.
Plus, research money and this year it has.
This number has increased for for those PhD student who moved into industry for another something like 70 students.
So so it's one of the figure which is very optimistic.
And actually when we look at the age structure of Slovenian researchers, Slovenian PHD's, it's one of the youngest in Europe.
So it's a good good indicator.
Of course we want to increase the cooperation between public sector and enterprises.

The biggest is Ljubljana University.

Maybe new in universities in Slovenia and and with this process of course.

Of course we have nonprofit research institutions and research units in business which are.
Which are growing.
Personnel so those who work in research and development.
This doesn't mean full-time equivalent that we fund, but those who doing research, working, research, and development are total 12,000.
Our funding is much, much less.
And what's interesting is that in in business sector it's women are are they have higher percentage, so it's more than 50% of women, which is a very good sign.
And actually if you look at this percentage is it comes out that that of course that top top positions are still.
Are still there is still more male than female, but but gaps are.
It is coming very quickly.
Closer together it's.
It's good good sign.

Research agency was established in the year 2000 and fourth before before the funding of science was through the ministry.
It's important to the establishment of research agency.
It's important.
In many ways, one of the most important is that that that's how it is organized.
How science is organized in other European countries.
So we can.
We can have the same kind of procedures, evaluations, procedures, the same.
Groups where we where we can communicate with European Union.

For example, there is an organization Europe Works Organization of research agencies and of course it's important that becausw the agency should be such that it's politically independent that decisions which we make are independent of the government.
So the decisions meaning who gets the projects.
And of course, it's not an easy task to come from the system where the ministry decided to independent situation privately.
I can tell you how, how not easy this is.
We know we're doing our budget.
It's more that's in year 2007, so it's actually pretty strong research agency.
We fund universities research institutes, so we are far the biggest funder of research in Slovenia.
Her what we do now is of course font research.
We try to have objective evaluation.
We invested a lot of effort in last years in this.
Hopefully we we came to the system.
I think we came to the system which is pretty close to to what we want.

Help in strategic decisions.
